00044 #define FTP_DATA_CONNECTION_OPEN       125
00045 #define FTP_OPENING_DATA_CONNECTION    150
00046 #define FTP_COMMAND_OK                 200
00047 #define FTP_FILE_STATUS                213
00048 #define FTP_READY_FOR_NEW_USER         220
00049 #define FTP_CONTROL_CONNECTION_CLOSED  221
00050 #define FTP_CLOSING_DATA_CONNECTION    226
00051 #define FTP_ENTERING_PASSIVE_MODE      227
00052 #define FTP_USER_LOGGED_IN             230
00053 #define FTP_FILE_ACTION_OK             250
00054 #define FTP_DIRECTORY_CREATED          257
00055 #define FTP_NEED_PASSWORD              331
00056 #define FTP_FILE_ACTION_PENDING        350
00057 #define FTP_TRANSFER_ABORTED           426
00058 #define FTP_FILE_ACTION_NOT_TAKEN      450
00059 #define FTP_BAD_LOGIN                  530 // FTP user authentication failed
00060 #define FTP_ACTION_NOT_TAKEN           550
00061 
00062 /* How to execute an ftp transaction:
00063  *
00064  *   1. Establish control connection
00065  *   2. Read greeting from remote ftp  (expect 220 or 2xx code)
00066  *   3. Execute login
00067  *         send "USER name"            (expect 331 or 2xx code meaning no password required)
00068  *         send "PASS password"        (expect 230 or 2xx code - 332 means needs ACCOUNT - not yet supported)
00069  *   4. Set type to binary (or appropriate)
00070  *         send "TYPE I"               (expect 200 or 2xx code)
00071  *         send "STRU F"  // note: default
00072  *         send "MODE S"  // note: default
00073  *   5. Cd to path
00074  *         send "CWD path"             (expect 250 or 2xx code or 550 or 5xx if doesn't exist)
00075  *   6. get file [see also below]
00076  *         send "PASV"                 (expect 227 followed by host ip address and port number as 8 bit ASCII numbers)
00077  *         connect to returned address
00078  *         send "RETR name"            (expect 150 or 1xx codes - 5xx if doesn't exist)
00079  *                                     (150 code will be followed by ".*( *[0-9]+ *byte" where number indicates file size)
00080  *         close data connection       (expect 2xx code - allow error on data connection if all bytes received)
00081  *      put file (optional ALLO size)
00082  *         send "STOR name"
00083  *      or put unique
00084  *         send "STOU name"
00085  *   7. Quit
00086  *         send "QUIT"                 (expect 221 then disconnect)
00087  *
00088  * handling restart for file transfer: (size==bytes received previously)
00089  *      send "REST size"               (expect 3xx)
00090  *      send "RETR name"...
00091  *
00092  * if PASV fails:
00093  *      choose port to listen to
00094  *      send "PORT a,b,c,d,p1,p2"
00095  *         (where a,b,c,d are ip address and p1,p2 are port)
00096  *      send "RETR"...
00097  *      wait for connection from ftp server
00098  */
00099 
00100 // MARK: send QUIT after receiving failed status instead of just closing connection (nicer)
00101 
00102 class USSLSocket;
00103

00117         UFtpClient(bool bSocketIsIPv6 = false) : UTCPSocket(bSocketIsIPv6)
00118                 {
00119                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFtpClient, "%b", bSocketIsIPv6)
00120 
00121                 tlsctrl = tlsdata = 0;
00122                 }

00125                 {
00126                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UFtpClient)
00127                 }

00133         bool connectServer(const UIPAddress& ip, int port = 21, uint32_t timeoutMS = U_TIMEOUT)
00134                 {
00135                 U_TRACE(0, "UFtpClient::connectServer(%p,%d,%u)", &ip, port, timeoutMS)
00136 
00137                 if (USocket::isClosed()) USocket::socket(SOCK_STREAM);
00138 
00139                 bool result = USocket::connectServer(ip, port) && waitReady(timeoutMS);
00140 
00141                 U_RETURN(result);
00142                 }
00143 
00144         bool connectServer(const UString& server, int port = 21, uint32_t timeoutMS = U_TIMEOUT)
00145                 {
00146                 U_TRACE(0, "UFtpClient::connectServer(%.*S,%d,%u)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(server), port, timeoutMS)
00147 
00148                 bool result = UTCPSocket::connectServer(server, port) && waitReady(timeoutMS);
00149 
00150                 U_RETURN(result);
00151                 }

00164                                   const char* passwd = "-lara@gmx.co.uk" /* Dash the password: save traffic by trying
00165                                                                                                                                                   to avoid multi-line responses */ );

00196         bool dataTransferComplete()
00197                 {
00198                 U_TRACE(0, "UFtpClient::dataTransferComplete()")
00199 
00200                 readCommandResponse();
00201 
00202                 U_RETURN(response == FTP_CLOSING_DATA_CONNECTION);
00203                 }

00232         // Execute an ftp transaction:
00233 
00234         // 1. Establish control connection
00235         // 2. Read greeting from remote ftp (expect 220 or 2xx code)
00236 
00237         int download(const UIPAddress& ip, const UString& path, off_t offset = 0)
00238                 {
00239                 U_TRACE(0, "UFtpClient::download(%p,%.*S,%I)", &ip, U_STRING_TO_TRACE(path), offset)
00240 
00241                 int result = (connectServer(ip) ? download(path, offset) : -1);
00242 
00243                 U_RETURN(result);
00244                 }
00245 
00246         int download(const UString& server, const UString& path, off_t offset = 0)
00247                 {
00248                 U_TRACE(0, "UFtpClient::download(%.*S,%.*S,%I)", U_STRING_TO_TRACE(server), U_STRING_TO_TRACE(path), offset)
00249 
00250                 int result = (connectServer(server) ? download(path, offset) : -1);
00251 
00252                 U_RETURN(result);
00253                 }
